meanings.definition: A stalk that supports a single flower in an inflorescence.
meanings.sent1: The pedicel of the rose held the delicate bloom.
meanings.sent2: The pedicel of the daisy was strong and sturdy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel balanced on the pedicel, pretending it was a tightrope.
meanings.sent4: Her love for nature was like a pedicel, always providing support and strength.
meanings.sent5: The pedicel swayed gently in the breeze, showcasing the beauty of the flower.

meanings.definition: A slender stem that connects the fruit to the main stem of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The apple hung from the pedicel, waiting to be picked.
meanings.sent2: The pedicel of the grape was long and flexible.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the pedicel as a swing, much to the plant's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The pedicel was like a lifeline, connecting the fruit to its source of nourishment.
meanings.sent5: The pedicel danced in the sunlight, ensuring the fruit received all it needed to grow.
